metadata.title: Waypoint by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Waypoint provides a modern workflow for build, deploy, and release across platforms.

alertBanner.text: Our community conference is taking place in San Francisco and online October 10-12.

integrationsConfig.description: A curated collection of official, partner, and community Waypoint Integrations.

integration.name: Google Cloud Run
integration.description: The Google Cloud Run plugin deploys a container to Google Cloud Run.

flags.name: Built-in
flags.description: This integration is shipped in the core product and does not need to be installed.

activeRelease.readme:
The Google Cloud Run plugin deploys a container to [Google Cloud Run](https://cloud.google.com/run).

### Components

1. [Platform](/waypoint/integrations/hashicorp/google-cloud-run/latest/components/platform/google-cloud-run-platform)
2. [ReleaseManager](/waypoint/integrations/hashicorp/google-cloud-run/latest/components/release-manager/google-cloud-run-release-manager)

### Related Plugins

1. [Docker](/waypoint/integrations/hashicorp/docker)

### Resources

1. Google Cloud Run service

components.readme:
<!-- This file was generated via `make gen/integrations-hcl` -->
Manipulates the Cloud Run APIs to make deployments active.

### Interface

- Input: **google.cloudrun.Deployment**
- Output: **google.cloudrun.Release**
components.name: Google Cloud Run Release Manager

components.readme:
<!-- This file was generated via `make gen/integrations-hcl` -->
Deploy a container to Google Cloud Run.

### Interface

- Input: **docker.Image**
- Output: **google.cloudrun.Deployment**

### Examples

```hcl
project = "wpmini"

app "wpmini" {
  labels = {
    "service" = "wpmini",
    "env"     = "dev"
  }

  build {
    use "pack" {}

    registry {
      use "docker" {
        image = "gcr.io/waypoint-project-id/wpmini"
        tag   = "latest"
      }
    }
  }

  deploy {
    use "google-cloud-run" {
      project  = "waypoint-project-id"
      location = "europe-north1"

      port = 5000

      static_environment = {
        "NAME" : "World"
      }

      capacity {
        memory                     = 128
        cpu_count                  = 2
        max_requests_per_container = 10
        request_timeout            = 300
      }

	  service_account_name = "cloudrun@waypoint-project-id.iam.gserviceaccount.com"

      auto_scaling {
        max = 10
      }

      cloudsql_instances = ["waypoint-project-id:europe-north1:sql-instance"]

      vpc_access {
        connector = "custom-vpc-connector"
        egress = "all"
      }
    }
  }

  release {
    use "google-cloud-run" {}
  }
}
```
components.name: Google Cloud Run Platform

variables.description: Configuration to control the auto scaling parameters for Cloud Run.

Maximum number of Cloud Run instances. When the maximum requests per container is exceeded, Cloud Run will create an additional container instance to handle load.
				This parameter controls the maximum number of instances that can be created.
CPU, Memory, and resource limits for each Cloud Run instance.
Number of CPUs to allocate the Cloud Run instance, min 1, max 2.
Maximum number of concurrent requests each instance can handle. When the maximum requests are exceeded, Cloud Run will create an additional instance.
Memory to allocate the Cloud Run instance specified in MB, min 128, max 4096.
Maximum time a request can take before timing out, max 900.
Specify list of CloudSQL instances that the Cloud Run instance will have access to.
GCP location, e.g. europe-north-1.
The port your application listens on.
GCP project ID where the Cloud Run instance will be deployed.
Specify a service account email that Cloud Run will use to run the service. You must have the `iam.serviceAccounts.actAs` permission on the service account.
Additional environment variables to be added to the Cloud Run instance.
Is public unauthenticated access allowed for the Cloud Run instance?
VPCAccess details
Set VPC Access Connector for the Cloud Run instance.
Set VPC egress. Supported values are 'all' and 'private-ranges-only'.

component.readme:
<!-- This file was generated via `make gen/integrations-hcl` -->
Deploy a container to Google Cloud Run.

### Interface

- Input: **docker.Image**
- Output: **google.cloudrun.Deployment**

### Examples

```hcl
project = "wpmini"

app "wpmini" {
  labels = {
    "service" = "wpmini",
    "env"     = "dev"
  }

  build {
    use "pack" {}

    registry {
      use "docker" {
        image = "gcr.io/waypoint-project-id/wpmini"
        tag   = "latest"
      }
    }
  }

  deploy {
    use "google-cloud-run" {
      project  = "waypoint-project-id"
      location = "europe-north1"

      port = 5000

      static_environment = {
        "NAME" : "World"
      }

      capacity {
        memory                     = 128
        cpu_count                  = 2
        max_requests_per_container = 10
        request_timeout            = 300
      }

	  service_account_name = "cloudrun@waypoint-project-id.iam.gserviceaccount.com"

      auto_scaling {
        max = 10
      }

      cloudsql_instances = ["waypoint-project-id:europe-north1:sql-instance"]

      vpc_access {
        connector = "custom-vpc-connector"
        egress = "all"
      }
    }
  }

  release {
    use "google-cloud-run" {}
  }
}
```
component.name: Google Cloud Run Platform

variables.description: Configuration to control the auto scaling parameters for Cloud Run.

Maximum number of Cloud Run instances. When the maximum requests per container is exceeded, Cloud Run will create an additional container instance to handle load.
				This parameter controls the maximum number of instances that can be created.
CPU, Memory, and resource limits for each Cloud Run instance.
Number of CPUs to allocate the Cloud Run instance, min 1, max 2.
Maximum number of concurrent requests each instance can handle. When the maximum requests are exceeded, Cloud Run will create an additional instance.
Memory to allocate the Cloud Run instance specified in MB, min 128, max 4096.
Maximum time a request can take before timing out, max 900.
Specify list of CloudSQL instances that the Cloud Run instance will have access to.
GCP location, e.g. europe-north-1.
The port your application listens on.
GCP project ID where the Cloud Run instance will be deployed.
Specify a service account email that Cloud Run will use to run the service. You must have the `iam.serviceAccounts.actAs` permission on the service account.
Additional environment variables to be added to the Cloud Run instance.
Is public unauthenticated access allowed for the Cloud Run instance?
VPCAccess details
Set VPC Access Connector for the Cloud Run instance.
Set VPC egress. Supported values are 'all' and 'private-ranges-only'.
